I want to ask you about the fabric which you mentioned and we talked about this at your investor day about when you think about the evolution of the campus network and the amount of inferencing traffic that's coming and how it just changed things. Why do you believe the fabric your your layer 2 fabric is ideally suited for the AI era? Yeah, you know, and and this is something that you will hear us talk about quite a bit because and you have talked you and I have talked about it for a while now. Look, think about it this way. , think of for a moment as an analogy. Think of inferencing as a brand new kind of application that has its own requirements and stuff. Every time you layer on an application on top of network, it has different kind of requirements all the way from bandwidth, SLA, latency, access, security, so on and so forth. So inferencing has very specific kind of requirements on the network and since more and more inferencing is actually happening outside of the data center. So now you don't have the pristine environment of a data center you just built 6 months ago. you have this messy enterprise, you know, network that has four or five generations of technology and you know, probably it's not as clean as you would like and now you need to make sure that inferencing is working well on this messy network and you know that is where we shine. And that is where enterprise fabric from us is purposeuilt for. So I believe as there's more and more inferencing on the edge or inside the enterprise is they're going to realize very quickly that the old school networks from a lot of different vendors are just not going to cut it. They don't even have the

us is purposeuilt for. They don't even have the serve that application the new application called inferencing. Yeah. Well and you know you think of the hierarchal networks we have companies designed them largely in the internet are for north south traffic. pretty much and we've shifted more to east west but really when it comes to AI you need both you need both and it's just almost like and I think in a fabric there's no concept of east west north there's just traffic well that's what I was going to talk about like the beauty of the fabric is that north south east west direction doesn't really matter right northwest southeast yeah [laughter] exactly you can go in whichever direction you can change your direction midway and stuff and and that's really the power of fabric and then this dynamic segmentation directly on the data plane that ties into the access security like UZNA for applications and data. Now all of that you bring it together and all of a sudden you say like why would I ever deploy anything other than this combination if I am putting inferencing in the enterprise side.
